titles.title: Approving the location of a memorial to commemorate the more than 5,000 slaves and free Black persons who fought for independence in the American Revolution.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 113-577.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 428.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 120.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/26/2014--Public Law. Approves the location of a commemorative work to honor the more than 5,000 slaves and free black persons who fought in the American Revolution.
